sen.j: 樺太開拓使（からふとかいたくし）は、明治3年（1870年）2月13日から明治4年（1871年）8月7日まで、樺太開拓のために設けられた官庁である。
sen.e: Sakhalin Development Commissioner is an authority arranged for the Sakhalin reclamation from February 13, 1870 to August 7, 1871.

sen.j: 開拓使から分離して設置されたが、1年余りで廃止して元に戻った。
sen.e: Although it was established in isolation from the Hokkaido Development Commissioner, it was abolished and combined again in a little more than one year.

sen.j: 樺太は江戸幕府がロシア政府と結んだ日露和親条約で日露混住の地とされ、王政復古 (日本)の後は箱館裁判所と箱館府の支配を経て、開拓使の管轄となった。
sen.e: Sakhalin, where the Japanese and the Russians lived under the treaty between the Russian Empire and the Empire of Japan signed between Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and the Russian government, was initially controlled by Hakodate District Court and Hakodate-fu after the Restoration of (Japanese) Imperial Rule, and later, by the Hokkaido Development Commissioner.

sen.j: 裁判所時代から現地の行政は岡本監輔（けんすけ）が執り、明治元年（1868年）と2年（1869年）から移住した日本人入植者約500人を指導していた。
sen.e: Kensuke OKAMOTO performed the public administration from the trial age and he led the settlers, about 500 Japanese who emigrated from 1868 and 1869.
Kensuke OKAMOTO performed public administration from the time of the Hakodate District Court and managed about 500 Japanese settlers who immigrated from 1868 and 1869.

sen.j: 岡本は、樺太移住者に無税の条件と当面の食糧供給などの厚遇を用意したが、定住は容易に進まなかった。
sen.e: OKAMOTO provided hospitality of tax-free condition and food supply for the Sakhalin settlers; nevertheless, the settlement did not progress easily.

sen.j: この間ロシア側の移住と開発の速度は日本側を上回り、さらに日本人との紛争が頻発した。
sen.e: During this period the speed of migration and development of Russia exceeded the Japan side, and also disputes with Japanese people occurred frequently.

sen.j: これには、現地の岡本が日露和親条約の効力を否定し、樺太を日本固有の領土とみなして、ロシア側の開発を原則拒否する態度を取っていたことにも原因があった。
sen.e: This was partly caused by the stance of Okamoto, who defying the effect of the treaty between the Russian Empire and the Empire of Japan and regarding the island as indigenous to Japan while he was in Sakhalin, in principle refused development of the island by the Russians.

sen.e: This was partly caused by the stance of Okamoto, who defied the effect of the treaty between the Russian Empire and the Empire of Japan, regarded the island as indigenous to Japan, and in principle refused the development of the island by the Russians.

sen.j: 岡本の考えは、日露和親条約は条約締結権のない徳川家の家臣が結んだものだから、天皇親政の時代には改めて国境を決定しなければならないというものだった。
sen.e: OKAMOTO's thought was that since the vassal of the Tokugawa family without the right of conclusion of a treaty contracted the treaty between the Russian Empire and the Empire of Japan, the border must be determined anew at the period of direct rule by the emperor.

sen.j: この見解は、幕府時代の条約を引き継いだという認識に立つ日本政府と異なるものであった。
sen.e: This view was different from the Japanese government which stood on recognition of having took over the treaty of shogunate era.

sen.j: 岡本は事態の緊急性を告げるべく上京した。

sen.e: On February 13, 1870, hearing about the report and sensing of danger, the government removed the administration of Sakhalin from the Hokkaido Development Commissioner and established the Sakhalin Development Commissioner.

sen.e: Then on Saturday, May 9, Kiyotaka KURODA was appointed as an undersecretary of the Hokkaido Development Commissioner (he is not an undersecretary of the Sakhalin Development Commissioner.) and considered as the executive managing director of Sakhalin.
